intro: Synsepalum attenuatum, commonly known as the African orange or false ackee, is a flowering plant native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow, egg-shaped fruits that resemble oranges. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in panicles. The fruit contains a single large seed surrounded by a fleshy, aromatic pulp that is edible and used in traditional cuisine.
